Package de.ikor.sip.foundation.core.declarative.scenario

Interface IntegrationScenarioDefinition

All Superinterfaces:
DeclarativeElement, Orchestratable<ScenarioOrchestrationInfo>
All Known Implementing Classes:
IntegrationScenarioBase
public interface IntegrationScenarioDefinition extends Orchestratable<ScenarioOrchestrationInfo>, DeclarativeElement
Interface used for specifying integration scenarios used within a SIP adapter.

Integration scenarios allow for decoupling of the connectors, as they define common domain models that must be used and mapped to/from by all connectors that provide or consume from the scenario.

Adapter developers should not implement this interface directly, but use IntegrationScenarioBase instead.

See Also:

  • IntegrationScenario

  • Method Details

    • getId

      String getId()
      Returns the ID of the integration scenario. Must be unique within the scope of the adapter.

      The scenario identifier should typically relate to the functional/business process the integration is supporting.

      Specified by:
      getId in interface DeclarativeElement
      Returns:
      Integration scenario identifier

    • getRequestModelClass

      Class<?> getRequestModelClass()
      Base class of the common request model used by the scenario. The model can be shared across multiple scenarios.
      Returns:
      Request model base class

    • getResponseModelClass

      Optional<Class<?>> getResponseModelClass()
      Base class of the common response model used by the scenario. The model can be shared across multiple scenarios.
      Returns:
      Response model base class, or Optional.empty() if the scenario does not have a response flow

    • hasResponseFlow

      default boolean hasResponseFlow()
      Returns whether the scenario has a response flow. The default implementation returns true if a response-model is set.
      Returns:
      True if the scenario has a response flow, false otherwise
